questions.question: What is the process of filling in missing values called?
questions.explanation: Imputation replaces missing data with substituted values.

questions.question: What technique scales data to a 0 to 1 range?
questions.explanation: This method rescales values to fit within a specified range.

questions.question: What method converts categorical data into numerical format?
questions.explanation: Encoding transforms categories into numbers for machine learning.

questions.question: What do you call values that are significantly different from others?
questions.explanation: Outliers are extreme values that deviate from the typical pattern.

questions.question: What process removes duplicate records from data?
questions.explanation: Deduplication ensures each record appears only once.

questions.question: What transformation reduces skewness by compressing large values?
questions.explanation: Log transformation makes skewed distributions more normal.

questions.question: What is the process of dividing continuous data into intervals?
questions.explanation: Binning groups numerical values into discrete categories.

questions.question: What technique creates new features from existing ones?
questions.explanation: Feature engineering builds new variables to improve model performance.

questions.question: What method scales data to have zero mean and unit variance?
questions.explanation: Standardization transforms data to a standard normal distribution.

questions.question: What is the first step in any data science project?
questions.explanation: Data cleaning removes errors and inconsistencies from raw data.
